node.title: ACT calls for end to mandates, contact tracing, QR codes
node.description: Party Leader David Seymour has called for a cost-benefit analysis of Covid-19 interventions, saying the current settings are a "mish-mash of rules that don't make sense".

node.title: Police name man shot dead in Nelson
node.description: Police have named the man whose death is the subject of a homicide inquiry in Nelson.

node.title: Ivanka Trump in talks to appear before Jan. 6 committee, spokesperson says
node.description: Last month, the committee tasked with investigating the January 6 attack asked Trump's daughter and former adviser to voluntarily speak with them.

node.title: Ukraine says one soldier killed, 6 wounded in separatist shelling
node.description: The Ukrainian military said on Wednesday one soldier had been killed and six wounded in shelling by pro-Russian separatists in east Ukraine in the past 24 hours as ceasefire violations remain at a…

node.title: Covid-19: Children and young people dominating south Auckland Omicron cases
node.description: Papakura Marae Health Clinic GP Dr Matire Harwood is seeing a rapid rise in Omicron case numbers and most of them are children.

node.title: Taranaki vaccination delivery on a roll in shadow of anti-mandate protest
node.description: While attention is focused on the protest at Parliament grounds, Covid-19 vaccinators have been busy delivering booster shots and inoculating under 12 year olds.

node.title: Drop in customer churn helps deliver 'positive' result for Sky TV
node.description: Sky TV plans to resume paying dividends to shareholders later this year after reporting revenue growth for the first time in six years.

node.title: 'Rather depressing' - Official cash rate rise hits first home buyers
node.description: The Reserve Bank's quarter percentage point rise in the official cash rate may have put an end to the one "saving grace" in the housing market. Audio

node.title: Blinken says Putin will "pay for a long, long time" for Ukraine invasion
node.description: "If this goes forward, what we have on the table, unprecedented sanctions, will have a severe impact," Secretary of State Blinken said.

node.title: GOP divided over response to Russian aggression in Ukraine
node.description: Republicans agree on criticism of President Biden's handling of the crisis, but they split on how much the U.S. should be involved in the conflict.

node.title: Veterans face "pretty tough" transition to jobs after military
node.description: More than half of veterans are unemployed for four months or longer after leaving the military, according to a study.

node.title: USPS to buy mostly gas-powered trucks for new fleet, defying Biden and EPA
node.description: USPS cited "fragile" finances in its decision to purchase a mostly gas-powered truck fleet.

node.title: Portraits reflect fears, joys, hopes of NYC's Chinatown community
node.description: A new book of portraits celebrates seniors and families of Manhattan Chinatown.

node.title: Covid-19: Auckland testing centres confident of meeting rapid antigen test demand
node.description: Thousands of rapid antigen tests were given out at Auckland community testing centres yesterday amid increasing demand as Omicron case numbers rise. Audio

node.title: COVID infection increases risk for dangerous heart problems, study finds
node.description: Problems include stroke, heart attack, myocarditis and irregular heart rhythms, according to the study.

node.title: Golden girl wins top Halberg Award
node.description: Olympian Dame Lisa Carrington's gold medal haul in Tokyo has seen her win big at the Halberg Awards.

node.title: 'A continuing loss of NZ's heritage': Iwi opposes plans for helipads on Aotea
node.description: Māori on Aotea / Great Barrier Island have told Auckland Council to stop helipads being put in, and to start paying them more heed as kaitiaki.

node.title: Limited air travel continues to hit Auckland Airport's bottom line
node.description: Auckland International Airport has reported another underlying loss, as the ongoing closure of borders continues to disrupt air travel.

node.title: Kiwibank reports half-year profit of $64m
node.description: Kiwibank has had a solid lift in profit on the back of increased mortgage lending and margins, but is looking to a slowdown in the housing market.

node.title: 'United front': NZ supports allies in sending 'clear message' to Russia over Ukraine
node.description: New Zealand's objection to Russia's aggressive actions over Ukraine is not weakened by the inability to impose its own economic sanctions, the Foreign Affairs Minister says. Audio

node.title: Fonterra lifts forecast farmgate milk price to record midpoint
node.description: The new range is $9.30 to $9.90 up from $8.90 to $9.50 per kilogram of milk solids. It comes after four consecutive solid lifts at the Global Dairy Trade Auction.

node.title: Robertson on support payments: 'It's really just about meeting costs'
node.description: The government's Covid-19 support payments have never been about helping businesses make money, but instead helping those doing it tough to meet costs, Deputy Prime Minister Grant Robertson says. Audio

node.title: Eight Oscars categories slashed from live telecast
node.description: The 94th Academy Awards have decided to cut eight categories from the live telecast of the show.

node.title: Democrats seize on GOP Senator Rick Scott's plan to tax more Americans
node.description: Senate Democrats plan to run ads seizing on Republican plan calling for more Americans to pay taxes.

node.title: Kaepernick launching initiative to provide free autopsies in "police-related" deaths
node.description: The initiative collaborates with a panel of board-certified forensic pathologists who perform autopsies, disclose preliminary findings and issue final reports to requesting families.

node.title: Explainer: How Western sanctions will target Russia
node.description: The United States and its allies are coordinating new sanctions on Russia after Moscow recognised two regions in eastern Ukraine as independent, officials said.

node.title: Government to announce next step in Omicron response
node.description: Those on the front line of the Omicron outbreak are hoping for a swift move to phase three of the government's response.

node.title: Islamic groups highlight 'significant' online extremism in NZ
node.description: The main focus at the hearing yesterday was on the impact of digital platforms, and this morning the terrorist's lawyer and the Human Rights Commission are expected to make submissions.

node.title: Hunters targeting feral goats in order to deal with deer problem
node.description: Authorities in Northland are trying to assess a problem deer population, but feral goats are getting in the way - so they're being targeted by professional hunters first.

node.title: Omicron outbreak hinders economic growth seen in last quarter of 2021
node.description: Economic activity staged a comeback in the last quarter of 2021, but is expected to be short lived.
